org.apache.river.test.impl.joinmanager

Class LeaseRenewDurRFE

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.river.qa.harness.QATestEnvironment
      • org.apache.river.test.share.BaseQATest
        • org.apache.river.test.spec.joinmanager.AbstractBaseTest
          • org.apache.river.test.impl.joinmanager.LeaseRenewDurRFE
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Test, TestEnvironment

    public class LeaseRenewDurRFE
extends AbstractBaseTest
    This class verifies that the current implementation of the JoinManager utility class has correctly implemented the following RFE: 6202650 - JoinManager should allow configurable control of the lease renewal interval

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Test construct(QAConfig sysConfig)
      Performs actions necessary to prepare for execution of the current test as follows: start 1 transient lookup service with locator listening on a specific port start 1 activation system using all the defaults (ports, etc.)
      void run()
      For each separate TestService started during construct, do the following: using a blocking lookup method on the service discovery manager, discover by service ID, the associated TestService; which will verify that the TestService was started correctly and has registered with the lookup service as expected using the proxy to the corresponding no-op service, destroy the shared VM in which the TestService (and no-op service) is running; which simulates "pulling the plug" on the TestService using a non-blocking lookup method on the SDM, query the lookup service to verify that the TestService is still registered with the lookup service; that is, verify that the lease has not expired yet wait a short amount of time past the time of expected expiration using a non-blocking lookup method on the SDM, query the lookup service to verify that the TestService is no longer registered with the lookup service; that is, verify that the lease has expired within the expected time frame, which verifies that the JoinManager used the maximum lease duration value that was configured

    • Constructor Detail

      • LeaseRenewDurRFE

    • Method Detail

      • construct

        public Test construct(QAConfig sysConfig)
               throws Exception
        Performs actions necessary to prepare for execution of the current test as follows:

        • start 1 transient lookup service with locator listening on a specific port
        • start 1 activation system using all the defaults (ports, etc.)
        • use locator discovery to discover the started lookup service
        • verify the lookup is discovered
        • retrieve the proxy to the lookup that was started
        • register a simple service with the lookup service, asking for a 'forever' lease (so that the lookup service will return its default maximum lease expiration)
        • retrieve the lease expiration from the registration and convert it to a duration relative to the current time
        • cancel the lease on the simple service
        • store the 'short' lease duration to be tested, as well as the the default maximum lease duration returned by the lookup service, for retrieval in the run() method
        • create identifying service IDs for all test services
        • set the basic info the service starter framework needs to start the test services
        • set the config info needed by the service starter framework itself
        • set the config info for the separate shared VMs to be created
        • set the common service descriptor info that is shared by each no-op service to be created and run in the associated shared VM, and which will be used to destroy that shared VM
        • set the common service descriptor info that is shared by each TestService to be created and run in the associated shared VM (for each TestService, a different shared VM will be created in which the TestService along with a no-op service will be run)
        • set the config override(s) that are common to all the TestService(s) (locators to discover and join)

          For each separate TestService to start, do the following:

          • set the service-specific config overrides - locators to join, service ID, service value (0, 1, 2, ...), lease duration to request
          • set the name of the sharedVM log directory the service starter should use for the shared VM in which the current TestService will run; this name should be different for each TestService
          • determine if the sharedVM log directory exists, and if it does, remove it so that the service starter can start the associated TestService
          • create the activation group (shared VM) in which the associated no-op service and corresponding TestService will run
          • start a no-op service in the shared VM just created; retrieve and store the resulting service proxy
          • start a TestService with associated lease duration ('short', default, etc.) in same shared VM as the corresponding no-op service just started

          Create a ServiceDiscoveryManager that will discover the same lookup service(s) as the TestService(s) just started, and which can be accessed by the run() method.

        Specified by:
        construct in interface TestEnvironment
        Overrides:
        construct in class AbstractBaseTest
        Parameters:
        sysConfig - the test properties
        Returns:
        Test to run.
        Throws:
        Exception - if any failure occurs during construct

      • run

        public void run()
         throws Exception
        For each separate TestService started during construct, do the following:

        • using a blocking lookup method on the service discovery manager, discover by service ID, the associated TestService; which will verify that the TestService was started correctly and has registered with the lookup service as expected
        • using the proxy to the corresponding no-op service, destroy the shared VM in which the TestService (and no-op service) is running; which simulates "pulling the plug" on the TestService
        • using a non-blocking lookup method on the SDM, query the lookup service to verify that the TestService is still registered with the lookup service; that is, verify that the lease has not expired yet
        • wait a short amount of time past the time of expected expiration
        • using a non-blocking lookup method on the SDM, query the lookup service to verify that the TestService is no longer registered with the lookup service; that is, verify that the lease has expired within the expected time frame, which verifies that the JoinManager used the maximum lease duration value that was configured
        Specified by:
        run in interface Test
        Specified by:
        run in class AbstractBaseTest
        Throws:
        Exception - if the test fails for any reason
